_header: Insufficiency of cunning and of wit
Bibliographic Ghosts: Untraced, Present whereabouts unknown Cited in the IMEV as ‘? Helmingham Hall’; possibly Newberry Library MS f36
_description: John Walton’s metrical version of Boethius (with Translator’s Preface and Prologue) — 7584 lines in 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) and rhyme royal (Books IV and V)

BodeMus53.First Lines:
INsufficiens of konnynge and of witteDefaute of langage and of
                    eloquence…
BodeMus53.Last Lines:
…but alle þise passeth yit intelligenceas be a sight of
                    þeire excellence
BodeMus53.Note: A few leaves cut out at end

BodRawPoe151.First Lines:
And eke in reuerence of ȝoure worthynesseThis symple werk as
                    for ane obseruaunce…
BodRawPoe151.Last Lines:
…Vn to þe presence of þe iuge on hyeþat all
                    þing doth beholde plenerly
BodRawPoe151.Note:
Begins imperfectly with the last four lines of Translator’s
                    Preface. At the end: ‘Explicit liber Boecii de consolacione philosophie de
                    latino in Anglicum translatus Anno domini anllmo cccc(mo) r(o) per capellanum
                    Iohannem’.

BodDou100.First Lines:
UN suffischaunce of kunnyng and of witDefawte of langage and of
                    eloquence…
BodDou100.Last Lines:
…And so of other craftes sewynglyDooth any þing þese
                    crafty men compel

OxfBal316A.First Lines:
INsuffishaunce of connyng & wytteDefaute of langage & of
                    eloquence…
OxfBal316A.Last Lines:
…Vn to þe presence of þe Iuge on hieThat all
                    þinge doth beholde plenerlye
OxfBal316A.Attributed Title:
Explicit liber Boicii de consolacione philosophie de latino in Anglicum
                        translatus per Iohannem Waltoun nuper Canonicum de Osenye Anno domini
                        Milesimo CCCCmo decimo (f. 109v)

OxfChrCh151.First Lines:
IN suffishaunce of connyng & wytteDefaute of langage & of
                    eloquence…
OxfChrCh151.Last Lines:
…Vn to þe presence of þe Iuge on hieThat all
                    þing doth beholde plenerly
OxfChrCh151.Note: Verse form: 8-line stanzas ababbcbc and rhyme royal
OxfChrCh151.Attributed Title:
Explicit liber Boitij de Consolacione Philosophie de Latino in Anglicum
                        translatus per Iohannem Waltonum nuper Canonicum de Oseneye Anno domini
                        1410 (at end)
OxfChrCh151.folio: first item in the manuscript (MS has no foliation)

OxfNew319.Note:
Begins imperfectly with the last two lines of Translator’s
                    Preface

CULGg418.First Lines:
The Whyle þat Rome Was regnyng in Hys FlouresAnd of þe
                    world held all þe monarchye…
CULGg418.Last Lines:
…Vn to þe presence of þe Iuge on hyeÞat all
                    thing doth behold plenerly
CULGg418.Attributed Title:
Explicit liber Boecii de consolacione philosophie de latino in anglicum
                        translatus Anno domini Mie ccccmo*mo Per
                        Capellum Johannem (f. 112v)

CULAdd3573.First Lines:
INsufficiaunce of conning and of WytDefaute of langage and of
                    Eloquence…
CULAdd3573.Last Lines:
…And so it hyndrith hym to a litill stoundeTo haue a maner
                    perdurablenesse…
CULAdd3573.Note:
Imperfect, with note ‘leaves 93-96 gone’; 3 other leaves
                    missing as noted in collation inside back cover

CamStJohn196.First Lines:
INsuffychance of Connyng And WitteDefaute of langage and of
                    eloquence…
CamStJohn196.Last Lines:
…Whiche on þe sight of his eterniteBene presente nowe but
                    to þe sight of man…

CamFitzMc184.First Lines:
Insufficience of connynge and witteDefaute of langage and
                    eloquence…
CamFitzMc184.Last Lines:
…Vnto þe presence of þe Iuge on hyeþat all
                    þing beholdeþ plenerlye
CamFitzMc184.Attributed Title:
Explicit liber Boicii de consolacione philosophie translatus de Latino
                        in Anglice 1410 anno (f. 119)

BLHar43.First Lines:
…Allas I wrech that whylom was in welþeAnd lusty song
                    vsede for to wryȝte…
BLHar43.Last Lines:
…ffor whi the knowyng of dyuyne sightHit gothe by fore
                    þat thyng þat shold be fall…
BLHar43.Note:
Without Translator’s preface or prologue; begins with 5-line
                    decorated initial; ends incomplete at usual lower margin of a
                    verso.

BLHar44.First Lines:
INsuffisaunce of cummyng and of wytteDefaute of langwage and of
                    Eloquence…
BLHar44.Last Lines:
…Vnto the presence of the Iuge an hyeThat al thyng doith be
                    holde playnerly
BLHar44.Note: With a Proheme of 31 st. on f. 2.
BLHar44.Attributed Title:
Boetius De Consolatione Philosophiae (f. 1v, added by a later
                    hand); Explicit liber Boecii de consolacione Philosophie de latino in
                        anglicum translatus Anno domini Millesimo CCCCmo xmo
                        per Capellanum Johannem (f. 102, by scribe)

BLRoy18Axiii.First Lines:
Insuffisiaunce of cunnyng & of witDefaut of langage & of
                    eloquence…
BLRoy18Axiii.Last Lines:
…Vnto þe presence of þe iuge on hyeThat all thinge
                    doth beholde plenerlye
BLRoy18Axiii.Note: 348 stanzas only; classmark changed as per Gray.
BLRoy18Axiii.Attributed Title:
Explicit liber Boetij de consolacione philosophie de latio in anglicum
                        translatus. Anno domini milesimo CCCCmo Xo per
                        capellum Iohannem (f. 113v)
BLRoy18Axiii.Editions:
Schuemmer,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             John Waltons metrische übersetzung der Consolatio
                Philosophiae.
Bonner Studien zur Englischen Philologie
         6. Bonn: Hanstein, 1914.

DULCosVii15.First Lines:
…Soo that in shenshippe And confusionOf alle this foule
                    worldy wrecchidnes…
DULCosVii15.Last Lines:
…vnto the presence of the Iugis on hyewhiche alle thynge
                    doothe beholde plenerly Explicit
DULCosVii15.Note:
Without first 8 of 9 stanzas of the Translator’s Preface (one
                    folio missing), so begins at line 65.
DULCosVii15.Attributed Title: Boetius his 5 Bookes of Philosophicall Comfort (f. 1v)

Lincoln103.Last Lines:

SocAnt134.First Lines:
Insuffisaunce of konnynge and of witDefaute of langage and of
                    eloquence…
SocAnt134.Last Lines:
…ffor to dilate his name and his renounAmonges hem þat
                    dwelle nyȝe present…
SocAnt134.Note: Breaks off in Book II, stanza 10.
SocAnt134.Attributed Title:
In nomine trino hoc opus incipio (f. 283va, rubric);
                        Explicit prefacio translatoris Incipit prologus eiusdem super librum
                        Boecii (f. 283vb); Explicit prologue Incipit liber Boecii
                        de consolacione philosophie (f. 285ra)

Chicago36.First Lines:
The wyle that Rome was reynyng in hys flowresAnd of the worlde
                    helde the monarclyeHe was gouerned than by emperowresAnd was renouned
                    wonder nobylye…
Chicago36.Last Lines:
…Vn to þe presennce of þe Iuge on hyeþat all
                    þing do be holde plenerly
Chicago36.Note:
Without Translator’s Preface. Followed by a Latin prose
                    recapitulation of the Consolatio Philosophiae, ‘per dominum I.
                    Glynton prorem scripsit. .148.’ [sic] (ff.
                    204-207v).

PhilRos108330.First Lines:
INsuffisaunce of kunnyng and of wytDefaute of langage and of
                    eloquence…
PhilRos108330.Last Lines:
…Vn to the presence off the Iuge on hyeThat al thyng dooth
                    beholde plenerlye
PhilRos108330.Note:
Folios not numbered; this has sig. a.1, beginning second half of
                    book.
PhilRos108330.Attributed Title:
Heere begynnyth Boys of the consolacioun of Philosophie (f. 78); Explicit
                    liber Boecii de consolacione philosophie de latino in Anglicum translatus Anno
                    domino Millesimo CCCC xo per Capellanum Johannem Teband Alias
                    Watyrbeche (177v = sig. n.2v)
